title: Alabama restaurant Teriyaki Madness in Hoover was cited for 8 violations with a 74 score
text:
19 minutes ago Teriyaki Madness Inspection Report Photo by Teriyaki Madness/Edited by Gary Smith/Canva/GR Teriyaki Madness in Hoover, Alabama, received a score of 74 during a routine inspection by the Jefferson County Department of Health on December 10, 2024. The Asian restaurant, located at 4741 Chace Cir #113, was cited for 8 violations , including 5 priority infractions.
State records showed that the inspection revealed issues with hand-washing practices, food safety certification, and proper storage of personal items.
According to the inspector's note, priority violations included employees observed not washing their hands for the required 15 seconds when returning to workstations and changing hand wear without proper hand washing. The restaurant lacked a certified manager on-site and employees with food handler cards.
Other priority violations contained an expired chemical test kit, a mop bucket obstructing access to a hand sink, and personal medications stored incorrectly.
Teriyaki Madness also failed to display its current permit and maintain the cleanliness of ceiling tiles and vent covers.
Despite correcting some priority violations on-site, Teriyaki Madness will require a follow-up inspection within 60 days due to its score falling between 70 and 84.
This Hoover, Alabama, restaurant remains open but must rectify these violations to improve its compliance with food safety regulations.
The last noted inspection at this location was on February 6, 2024, when the restaurant had a 94 score.
When writing this report, Teriyaki Madness has a 4.0-star rating from 281 opinions on Google reviews.
Priority Violations:
Unsuitable hand-washing practices Absence of certified manager and food handler certifications Expired cleaning test kit Obstructed access to hand sink Unsuitable storage of personal medications Please Share Your Thought:
